original_table_html:
|               | *Business Markets* _(pp 188–190)_ |
| OBJECTIVE 6-2 | Identify the major factors that influence business buyer behavior.  
|               | *Business Buyer Behavior* _(pp 190–195)_ |
| OBJECTIVE 6-3 | List and define the steps in the business buying decision process.  
|               | *The Business Buyer Decision Process* _(pp 195–197)_ |
| OBJECTIVE 6-4 | Discuss how new information technologies and online, mobile, and social media have changed business-to-business marketing.  
|               | *Engaging Business Buyers with Digital and Social Marketing* _(pp 197–199)_ |
| OBJECTIVE 6-5 | Compare the institutional and government markets and explain how institutional and government buyers make their buying decisions.  
|               | *Institutional and Government Markets* _(pp 199–203)_ |
summary_markdown: This content outlines key objectives and corresponding sections related to business buyer behavior and marketing. It begins by identifying major factors influencing business buyer behavior, followed by a definition of the steps within the business buying decision process. The material then addresses the impact of new information technologies, including online, mobile, and social media, on business-to-business marketing. Finally, it compares institutional and government markets, explaining the distinct buying decision processes employed by buyers in these sectors. The structure appears to be a progressive exploration of business marketing concepts, moving from foundational influences to specific market types and modern digital strategies.
